thread.title: Miranda Hart was “too ill” to return to filming Call The Midwife after mystery illness left her 'not feeling herself'
thread.title_full: Miranda Hart was “too ill” to return to filming Call The Midwife after mystery illness left her 'not feeling herself'

author: Jessica Gibb
title: Miranda Hart was “too ill” to return to filming Call The Midwife after mystery illness left her 'not feeling herself'
text:
Miranda Hart was “too ill” to return to filming Call The Midwife after mystery illness left her 'not feeling herself' TV favourite suffered from a mystery illness Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Miranda Hart reportedly cancelled her long-waited TV comeback because of a mystery illness. 
The funny woman was set to return as Chummy in Call The Midwife’s Christmas special and for its sixth series – but she had to pull out. 
Miranda cancelled her return just months before filming started leaving creator Heidi Thomas having to rewrite episodes based around Chummy. 
The illness also left the 44 year old too unwell to exercise. Miranda Hart as Chummy in Call The Midwife (Photo: BBC) 
“I don’t feel myself at the moment because I was ill last year and I wasn’t able to exercise,” she said at a comedy gig on Tuesday night, according to The Sun . 
But a rep for the actress insisted that Miranda is now back at work. 
“Miranda has a wealth of upcoming projects,” the spokeswoman said. Chummy with baby Freddie in the 2013 Christmas special (Photo: BBC) 
The Miranda star left the BBC1 drama for three years to work on other TV shows. 
She was tipped to revive The Generation Game for BBC1 after filming a pilot. 
The modern take on the show, previously hosted by Larry Grayson, Bruce Forsyth and Jim Davidson, was put on the backburner due to Miranda’s other projects. Miranda plans to break America (Photo: PA) 
In 2015, she made her big screen debut with a major role in action comedy Spy, alongside co-stars Melissa McCarthy and Jude Law. 
The breakthrough came after Miranda admitted wanting to crack America. 
Speaking on The Graham Norton Show this year, she said: “I’m not going to lie, I would love the opportunity to go out there for a few months and potter about on a film set and do the odd scene.” Like us on Facebook
